instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan spin
threads.message:
Hi Guys I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Core i9 with a high fan spin. I have tried to change the fan but still the same. Checked all lines going to the fan no shorts there. Any other component that can cause this? The Mac works fine, temp reading and all are good and its fast, just fan running max speed and even with Mac fan control I am not ably to turn it lower. SMC issue maybe?

Did some measurement and found that <SIGNAL>FAN_LT_PWM</SIGNAL> is 0.6v and <SIGNAL>FAN_RT_PWM</SIGNAL> 2.5v maybe an issue there? I do not know what it should be, but seems to be too big of a difference? Also tried another trackpad with cable but same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan spin
threads.message:
Which fan spins high?
Compare voltage and diode mode readings between <TRANSISTOR>Q6000</TRANSISTOR>/50.
Be sure about traces continuity until connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> High fan spin
threads.message: It is the right fan. So in the meantime i tried another display assembly (webcam) to no avail. Will check again for broken traces. Are around <TRANSISTOR>Q6050</TRANSISTOR> looks clean and all resistor seem OK too.
